meanings.definition: Comparative form of blowy: more windy or breezy
meanings.sent2: The beach is always blowier in the evenings.
meanings.sent3: The kite flew even higher in the blowier wind.
meanings.sent4: The blowier weather carried the scent of flowers far.
meanings.sent5: The blowier gusts made the trees dance wildly.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of blowy: having a tendency to boast or brag
meanings.sent1: He became blowier after winning the game.
meanings.sent2: Her blowier attitude often rubbed people the wrong way.
meanings.sent3: The blowier talker in the group always had a story to share.
meanings.sent4: His blowier claims were soon proven false.
meanings.sent5: The blowier speaker loved to hear himself talk.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of blowy: having a fuller or more rounded shape
meanings.sent1: The blowier clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The blowier pumpkin won first prize at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The blowier balloon floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her blowier cheeks flushed with embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The blowier hills rolled gently in the distance.
